properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 31 at 10:17AM PST until January 3 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet with local sets to
8 feet developing this morning building to 8 to 10 feet with
local sets to 12 feet Wednesday through Friday. Dangerous rip
currents are likely.

* WHERE...Ventura County beaches. The largest surf is expected
on west facing shores.

* WHEN...From 3 AM Tuesday to 8 PM PST Friday.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip
currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large
breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and
rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest surf will occur on west facing
beaches. This high surf advisory could also be expanded for the
remaining south coast beaches in Santa Barbara County Wednesday
and Thursday.
properties.instruction:
Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay
near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in
such conditions, stay off the rocks.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST FRIDAY
